title: Alesana Tuilagi
text:
Alesana "Alex" Tuilagi (born 24 February 1981) is a former <a href="Samoans">Samoan</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby</a> rugby player. He is a retired footballer, currently residing in Fogapoa Savaii and has appeared numerous times for his national team <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Samoa</a>. He previously played for <a href="Rugby%20Parma%20F.C.">Parma</a> in Italy and for <a href="Leicester%20Tigers">Leicester Tigers</a> in the <a href="Aviva%20Premiership">Aviva Premiership</a> and more recently <a href="Newcastle%20Falcons">Newcastle Falcons</a>. As an incredibly strong player, Tuilagi uses his blend of pace and power to good effect, proving a nightmare for many defences. Such a combination of speed and strength makes him very difficult for defences to handle.
Career.
The Tuilagi family has strong connections with Leicester Tigers; Alesana's brothers <a href="Henry%20Tuilagi">Henry</a>, <a href="Anitelea%20Tuilagi">Anitelea (Andy)</a>, and <a href="Freddie%20Tuilagi">Fereti (Freddie)</a> are all former players and two younger brothers, <a href="Sanele%20Vavae%20Tuilagi">Vavae</a> and <a href="Manu%20Tuilagi">Manu Tuilagi</a> both played in a game for Leicester Tigers against the <a href="Classic%20All%20Blacks">Classic All Blacks</a>, on 25 May 2008.
Whilst at Parma, whom he played with for two seasons, he was equal second top <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> scorer of the league for the 2003–04 season, with 12 tries in total for the season. He helped them get to the semi-finals of both the domestic competition, and the <a href="2003%E2%80%9304%20European%20Shield">Parker Pen Shield</a>. He made his debut for Samoa in a <a href="2003%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2003 Rugby World Cup</a> qualifier against Fiji in June 2002.
He was included in the <a href="Pacific%20Islanders%20rugby%20union%20team">Pacific Islanders rugby union team</a> tour to Europe in late 2006 and played a significant part in the Samoan national teams' successes in the <a href="Rugby%20World%20Cup%20in%202007">Rugby World Cup in 2007</a>.
Tuilagi enjoyed his best-ever season in 2010/11, finishing the season as the club's top try-scorer and as <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Aviva%20Premiership">Aviva Premiership</a> top scorer for the first time. The big Samoan collected 17 tries in all competitions, with 13 in the Premiership, including the match-winner in the semi-final against Northampton Saints and a hat-trick against Gloucester at Welford Road.
Playing alongside younger brother Manu, Alesana lined up against older sibling Henry during the Heineken Cup in 2010/11 and has also played against Anitelea in the Premiership. Tuilagi has started eight of Tigers’ nine finals since 2006/07, missing out only on the Guinness Premiership Final against London Irish in 2009 due to suspension. He was Man of the Match in the 2006/07 Premiership Final win over Gloucester, scoring two tries, and started the 2010 final when Leicester defeated Saracens. He was also named Supporters’ Player of the Year in same season.
Tuilagi was again included in 's squad to the <a href="2011%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2011 Rugby World Cup</a> in New Zealand. He started in all 4 pool games and scored a hat trick against . After the eight years with Leicester, Tuilagi left following the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Aviva%20Premiership">2011–12 Aviva Premiership</a> season to join <a href="NTT%20Communications%20Shining%20Arcs">NTT Communications Shining Arcs</a> of the Japanese <a href="Top%20League">Top League</a>. On 8 May 2014, Tuilagi returned to England to compete in the <a href="Aviva%20Premiership">Aviva Premiership</a> with <a href="Newcastle%20Falcons">Newcastle Falcons</a> on a two-year contract, rejoining with his brother <a href="Anitelea%20Tuilagi">Anitelea Tuilagi</a>.
Historic win.
Tuilagi was part of the Samoan squad that beat 32 – 23 on 17 July 2011 at Sydney in a test match. Tuilagi made the opening try as Samoa ran in 4 tries to Australia's two.
On 25 June 2013 Tuilagi was called up to the Samoan squad for the SA tour and the 2013 Pacific Cup
Personal life.
Tuilagi has five brothers <a href="Henry%20Tuilagi">Henry</a>, <a href="Anitelea%20Tuilagi">Anitelea (Andy)</a>, <a href="Freddie%20Tuilagi">Fereti (Freddie)</a>, <a href="Sanele%20Vavae%20Tuilagi">Vavae</a> and <a href="Manu%20Tuilagi">Manu Tuilagi</a> who are all <a href="rugby%20union">rugby</a> players. He and <a href="Manu%20Tuilagi">Manu</a> are both <a href="Catholic">Catholic</a>.
He was arrested on August 26, 2014 in Dublin after presenting himself at Dublin Airport. A European arrest warrant had been issued relating to an assault in a Dublin night club a number of years previously.
